sequences

Interface MassSequence

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Sequence
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    ProteinFastaSequence, ProteinFastaSequences

    public interface MassSequence
extends Sequence

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int getIntegerMass(long index)
      This is a special method to handle protein fasta sequences in which allows the query of a mass of an amino at a certain index.
      int getIntegerMass(long start, long end)
      Calculates the mass of a segment of this sequence.
      boolean hasMass(long position)
      Checks whether this position can be translated into a mass.

      • Methods inherited from interface sequences.Sequence

        getAlphabet, getAlphabetAsBytes, getAlphabetSize, getAnnotation, getByteAt, getBytes, getCharAt, getId, getMatchingEntry, getMatchingEntry, getSize, getStartPosition, getSubsequence, isInAlphabet, isTerminator, isValid, toByte, toChar, toString

    • Method Detail

      • getIntegerMass

        int getIntegerMass(long index)
        This is a special method to handle protein fasta sequences in which allows the query of a mass of an amino at a certain index.
        Parameters:
        index - the index of the item in which mass we want to know
        Returns:
        the integer mass of the amino acid at the given position, 0 if the position corresponds to a TERMINATOR or unknown amino acid.

      • getIntegerMass

        int getIntegerMass(long start,
                 long end)
        Calculates the mass of a segment of this sequence.
        Parameters:
        start - the start of the segment (inclusive)
        end - the end of segment (exclusive)
        Returns:
        the integer mass of the given segment. If there are unknown amino acids in the segment, their masses will be treated as 0.

      • hasMass

        boolean hasMass(long position)
        Checks whether this position can be translated into a mass.
        Parameters:
        position - the position to check
        Returns:
        true if this has a mass, false otherwise.
